topics.body:
Slow night huh?

I know I don't post often about myself, but often times I internally think about things and a lot of things and I know I've talked about it once in a while how I have mental problems, I'm doing fine no need to worry guys, but I often think on this subject and honestly I fascinate myself cause I'm what is called a outlier(basically a perosn who falls outside of normal characteristics for things) and my own mind interests me.  I used to have numerous things to the point you couldn't psychically touch me without me having a complete breakdown(if you hugged me back then I would have smashed your face into a desk and began beating the shit out of you while crying and laughing) and over the past five years I've reach the point where I no longer have the vast majority of them *without any medication or any psychiatric help until three months ago*.  I'm actually doing fairly well actually; the main things I'm taking care of is me being transgender is interfering with my schoolwork, but I've started working on transitioning because if I weren't to start I would psychologically stop working; the other thing is I wouldn't call it necessarily depression so much as massive emotional and physical dissociation.  Basically even though I seem normal and express normally I don't actually "feel" much emotions at all.

To use a analogy I'm like Hata no Kokoro; I can express emotions, but I don't "feel" them a lot and I don't "feel" a lot of things.  To use a extreme analogy I can technically feel pain but I'm dissociated with it in that if I were caught off guard and injured it would just confuse me more than anything else.  It's probably why I seem like such a strong person both physically and mentally because if I'm doing physical work I can work until my body gives out cause I don't "feel" the tiredness and why I seem strong to people mentally cause I don't "feel" the sadness or such.  Oh sure emotional situations do effect me still, but they effect my ability to function rather than me actually feeling depressed or sad.  I do have emotions; just not nearly to the level everyone else has.

Tl:dr; UC9 in a nutshell:
!http://i.ytimg.com/vi/lIM1mCzCLCY/maxresdefault.jpg!
Tl:dr that don't get the analogy; I'm good at acting as though I'm emotional, but I'm not good at actually being emotional.

Side note: god help you if you ever play poker against me.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
